website_summaries.verdict: A good storage, mooring, or towing option that fits a wide range of boats, although this option may not be durable enough for some.
pros: Fits a wide variety of 12-foot to 23-foot boats (68-inch to 106- inch beam), including v-hull, tri-hull, and sailboats
Material is a silver-coated marine-grade polyester canvas
Waterproof, and resists tears, UV, and mildew
Comes with integrated straps, buckles, and a storage bag
cons: Some buyers found this to be too light and thin
Arrives a bit smaller than expected, so think about ordering up a size

customer_reviews.title: I was a little concerned about the size but the ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned about the size but the sizing description was accurate and it fits my boat as expected. The pictures do not show that there are also clips at the front of the cover and two at the back of the cover and three shorter straps to secure the front to the tongue of the trailer and the back to either the trailer or the bottom of the motor. I secured the back to the back of the bunk boards. It took me about 20 minutes to install the first time at which time I drove almost 200 miles topping out at roughly 75 mph and had no issues with the cover ripping or coming loose.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R.

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 13' whaler sport perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I got the 14-15' size and it fits my 13' whaler sport, including covering the engine - perfect for winter storage, can reuse, and cheaper than shrink wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Seems decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Got me through my first year and so far so good. Standing water does leak through. Showing some fading from the sun. I bought it large to help cover further down the sides and cover the motor. Was a good idea, but it still doesn't protect the sides from the sun as much as I had hoped. east to get on and off. I am happy so far and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Scar83

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: The fit is great, have a lot of wind /sun in Nevada hope the material holds up, added foam on the stern corners just in case, overall, the results after several months will tell, good product would recommend
customer_reviews.author: buster

customer_reviews.title: Worked ok for about a year
customer_reviews.text: The inside has completely deteriorated and came apart inside my boat., comes with all the tie downs u need .....would definitely not would buy again..
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G.

customer_reviews.title: Rugged quality
customer_reviews.text: Great cover, especially at this price. Rugged materials and stitching. I use this to cover up my kayak, and for whatever reason, it keeps the contents significantly cooler than a tarp. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Go Bruins

customer_reviews.title: Great cover.  Fits great over high bow rails, and rear taffrail.
customer_reviews.text: I live on a lake, own 3 boats, and a wave runner. The cover was offered as a "lightening deal," for $75. I could not be happier. Heavy Denier, with backing in stress areas. Fits my 80 Shamrock like a glove even with the high bow rails, and teak taffrails in the back. I took a gamble and am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: YES! It is waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I had my doubts when this little box showed up at my door-step. It was very lightweight. I needed a boat cover that was water proof, but wasn't sure this was it. After about a month or so I can attest that this cover is indeed water proof. My old (new) canvas cover was worthless when it came to keeping my boat dry. It's so nice to pull the cover off and have a nice dry boat! It will be interesting to see how long it holds up.So far, I an extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: bula936

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfull cover.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. Good price. Fits the boat fine. Has plenty of loops and cords to keep the cover in place. Doesn't last forever because it has to endure 110 degrees in the summer. Sun is hard on everything. We will buy another when we need to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be good quality for this price point but my boat is ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good quality for this price point but my boat is 17.5 ft and it was really tight trying to get it to stretch to the back. I'm concerned it might be to tight hope it doesn't rip. 18 ft or larger I would go up a size.ill post a pic of mine. I have a bimini top installed so that may be a problem too but they don't mention it in the add. I would also cover any corners as it is real thin material but does seem waterproof. Not sure if I want to trailer with it on or not. If I do I'll update.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF

customer_reviews.title: Shiny silver color, like the straps which attach to the boat trailer
customer_reviews.text: Really like this boat cover so far (haven't had it long enough to judge effects of UV exposure over time). It is a shiny silver color, which generally means it's reflecting the sun's rays. I also like the straps which attached to the frame. My previous cover had straps that went under the boat, and they were a bear to put in place. If you need a longer strap you can put two together. So far, quite impressed! I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars because invariably boat covers wear out or are blown out after a couple years. You may consider getting the next larger size. Mine fits quite snugly just over the top, just like the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: craigery

customer_reviews.title: Nice boat cover
customer_reviews.text: I put the cover on a triton SF-21. With the motor trimmed all the way down, the cover fit across the gunwale and covered the motor. The fabric is seems thin and I will have to be careful, I am happy with what I received.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great cover for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a few boat covers over the last few years and this is one of the best quality ones i have come across in this price range. the stitching, straps, and fabric seem to be good quality, I hope it holds up through the Montana winter!
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Just as described.  Will fit perfectly w/o slack.
customer_reviews.text: Nice cover. Sturdy, good material, perfect color & strong fitted bottom. Bought the 17-19 for 18.6' dual console with outboard. Fits boat perfectly, but not enough slack to cover motor. Could definitely use instructions for straps!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: I have a nautic star 210 coastal angler, picklefork ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a nautic star 210 coastal angler, picklefork Tri-hull design. I decided to try this cover, ordered the 23ft 100" beam . My beam is 98" the way my center console takes the slack, it barely fits. But it does fit and it does deflect the leaves and rain. I get one puddle right by the outboard cowling. I would not trailer it down an interstate though due to the snug fit I have. Get the next size bigger without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: wewa

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover
customer_reviews.text: Fit the 14 ft boat I needed to cover. Haven’t used in winter yet but hold up well so far for the summer/ windy weather. Edit October 2019: still using cover and has lasted throughout the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkplug

customer_reviews.title: The cover is easy to put on my 14' Jon boat
customer_reviews.text: The cover is easy to put on my 14' Jon boat. The dual straps are a great addition for those who want to tow their boat with the cover on or just use the cover when the boat is parked. The straps are quick and easy to a tighten.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: A little small.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t fit my 13’ Boston Whaler. Supposed to be up to 14’ with a 68” beam. My Whaler is definitely smaller. It came close enough that I’ll keep it, though. Just finished washing my boat and didn’t want to wait to ship it back get another cuz I’d have to wash it again. I can make do with how it is. If you have a 13’ Whaler get a larger size. The pic is short, but, that’s how far back the cover got with two people pulling on it.
customer_reviews.author: Judothrow

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money but fading out after two weeks
customer_reviews.author: Tom Slimick

customer_reviews.title: Great cover.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these. One for a 15' and one for a 12' boat. The straps were placed great, and the extra protection on the corners were great. The only thing I need to do is when I take it off I need to put a marker on the front so I don't have to try and figure out which end is the front.
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a glove and very sturdy. Very nice that the ties were also included.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Anne Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I like this boat cover. For the same price as the standard one from Academy you get the same quality material with the added benefit of straps with buckles instead of nylon rope. It fit our 17 foot ski boat with outboard motor perfectly, and has so far held up to the random weather here in Louisiana.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Martin

customer_reviews.title: Modified this for a sailboat
customer_reviews.text: We used this cover as a starting point for covering our sailboat. We cut and sewed in a zipper, a collar for the mast, and slits for the cables. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Lukemakes7

customer_reviews.title: Not as big as I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: So far the cover seems to be okay. My only concern is I got it for a 12 to 14 foot boat and it's barely fitting over my 13 foot fiberglass boat.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Material feels strong and it kept water out during its first full day of rain. A diagram of how to use the straps through the upper sleeves would have been helpful
customer_reviews.author: David B. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Size variations
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 15.5' boat. The 14-16' size was way too small. So, I returned for the 16-18 size. This is way too big, but covers the boat. So, I just tighten the straps more.
customer_reviews.author: N/A

customer_reviews.title: Great boat cover and a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: This cover for my bass boat perfect. It seems to be very well made and the price was great. It was very easy to put on the boat and the down.I would recommend this boat cover.
customer_reviews.author: Specialk1122

customer_reviews.title: Nice boat cover
customer_reviews.text: It was great & for the price it was better. But its not the thickest if you have sharp corners take that into thought.
customer_reviews.author: MaChelle

customer_reviews.title: Good company.
customer_reviews.text: I got a full refund for this product. The manufacturer was great to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product only problem is has to many tie downs it takes to long to tie down cover.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest King jr

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Boat Cover
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I am really pleased with this cover. Though it is a little long for my 12' boat, since it is made for 12'-14' boats, I am okay with this slight issue. It is lighter weight than I anticipated, but it held up to 60 mph winds a few days after I installed it. It is also water-proof.
customer_reviews.author: JJG

customer_reviews.title: Got a rip in the side from the wind after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Nice cover fits very well don't let no water in
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You guys got to do better than this it's not even waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: It showed up missing for straps and his traps that came with it were so flimsy they snuck as soon as you try to touch them. The canvas ripped almost immediately do not buy this product. Either send me a better one or you pay for shipping for this fart cart to come back to you. I'm not going to let it go just destroyed my Bayliner over one rainstorm. iPhone all the proper instructions and everything your clasps fail almost. I had to pull out my bilge pump and pump the water off the top of it which is like 3 gallons as it drained into my boat simultaneously what a waste of space and finite resources.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Quality cover even when trailing..
customer_reviews.text: Just a bit to large for a 15’ Smokercraft but with a few bungee cords it fits like a costom cover...
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL FOR A 21 FOOT BOAT!
customer_reviews.text: The cover I purchased was supposed to be for a 20 to 23 foot runabout style boat. My boat is exactly 21 feet bow to stern and the cover is too short! Unfortunately I waited past my 30 day return window before I tried to install it. Please be advised that the cover that says 20 to 23 foot will not fit a 21 foot boat! It looks like it might barely cover a 20 foot boat, maybe.
customer_reviews.author: smackey02

customer_reviews.title: Did not last 3 Months, material deteriorated in the sun, torn material everywhere
customer_reviews.text: WARNING do not buy this cover if your boat is is outside in sunlight. The material is waterproof, but thin and quickly deteriorated in the sun. I had the cover on my boat for no longer than 3 months and it tore to shreds, totally unusable, a waste of money. This is by far the worst item I ever purchased thru Amazon. What a waste of money and my time, no to mention my boat is now unprotected till I order another cover. This cover at best could only function as a dust cover.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: No vents!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this cover solely based on the fact that the information said it had rear vents. It does not! Completely dissatisfied! Can not reach the seller of course. Extremely unhappy with my purchase and definitely would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Paul

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR ALL BOATS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a 14 foot boat. It was way to big so it sagged inside the boat. I made round top frames to hold it up but it sagged between them and the rain pooled between. I ended up with a half a foot of water in the boat anyway. The water went right through it. Whats it good for ? Well maybe it'll keep the leaves out. And I don't think it can reach on a 16 foot boat.
customer_reviews.author: David of Tracer Image

customer_reviews.title: ... see how it wears outside but for the price good deal.
customer_reviews.text: Fit My 20ft sea ray cuddy cabin perfectly a little thin but we'll see how it wears outside but for the price good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Boating Bob

customer_reviews.title: Fits good; time will test durability
customer_reviews.text: Our ski boat cover needs replacing; sun wore out the rear part due to exposure, otherwise, it lasted for a long time. Purchased this one in hopes that it fits, you never know. Delivered as promised, straps included in box. At 1st try, elastic cord seemed tight, but eventually the cover fit nicely. Will not be using cover while trailering, so opted for bungees instead of straps. 3 star rating for now for waterproof and durability, as only time will tell. It's summer now, let's see how it handles the winter rain and wind later this year.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Misleading information
customer_reviews.text: This cover is advertised as being made of 600 denier fabric. When it arrived the label clearly indicated it was made of 150 denier fabric. If I had wanted a lightweight cover I could have purchased it a local retailer at a much lower cost. Because the product information was erroneous I am returning this cover. I have found other instances where product information was either flat out wrong or misleading. Be sure to check the product you receive against what Amazon provides in their product information.
customer_reviews.author: Chris at Bigfork, MT

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems better than competitors.
customer_reviews.text: The 17-19’ size fit my 18’ open bow ski boat lengthwise very well. It is plenty wide, which required the use of taller support poles than my previous cover. Actually I like the extra height. Also I like that it includes straps to go over the top as well as straps to tie down to the trailer. So far The quality seems much better than the last 600D 2year warranty cover it replaced. This one is a different brand and hopefully is more durable. Time will tell. I will update you in 2021.
customer_reviews.author: rabidoutfitterdotcom

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This cover is AMAZING! It is super easy to get it on the boat, the clips are super easy to get the cover tight so it doesn't blow around. I was able to get it on the boat by myself. Our last cover only lasted through one storm, whereas this one made it through a few wind storms and one rain storm so far, it didn't even move an inch! Of course it's back in storage now that it's fall. I have a 21in Chris Craft and it fit perfectly! It's worth every cent! I wouldn't waste my money on anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Rockelle

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.text: The first and only time I used this cover two strap loops ripped off within a half mile of my home. Halfway through a 380 mile trip the the thing had almost completely ripped in half (please see attached photos). I had to stop every hour on the trip to add additional straps & bungee cords because it looked like I had a parachute behind me instead of my bass boat. This is the worst product I've purchased on Amazon in over 20 years of being a customer and I'm perplexed as to where the multiple 5 star reviews came from. Good luck if you buy this piece of excrement.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Not water proof just water resistant
customer_reviews.text: This is my second review it does fit the boat very nice it appears to be built of decent quality good craftsmanship they claim it is waterproof it is not it is only water resistant we had heavy rains last night I do have props underneath the tarp so the water can not puddle on the tarp when I uncovered it this morning everything is still wet definitely better than no tarp at all but it is not water Proof if you were trying to sleep under this and it rain you would get wet
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Indoor use only! Fits a Vintage Boston Whaler.
customer_reviews.text: Update after only 1 month of outdoor use it has faded badly so I covered the cover with a ugly blue tarp for fear it won't last at all...so forget the rest. It does not have enough or perhaps any uv protection what a shame.... Well made appears to be very solid. Time will tell but at first impression it looks and feels great. Fight my classic 1968 Boston Whaler 13 with the outboard. I just ran the covers bow -V towards the motor since the vintage Whaler is square up front and it is a very nice fit.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold V

customer_reviews.title: Good cover at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can’t beat it. The straps are not sewn in on top like my previous covers. But after getting them all adjusted they are set & not worth the extra $50 for that feature. They send extra straps for the bottom too in case you ever need them. Seems durable and the size is exactly right on. Time will tell but I think it’s going to be a good cover.
customer_reviews.author: taximom

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works really well, we will see how it lasts through winter
customer_reviews.author: Tim Klemens

customer_reviews.title: ‘17 Triton 18TRX w/Ultrex & 12” Graphs
customer_reviews.text: Have a ‘17 Triton 18TRX w/Ultrex & 12” Humminbirds. Needed a cover for overnight trips for bad weather and to keep things out of sight. Haven’t trailered with it and prob won’t but for a sub $100 boat cover this one seems to be perfect for my needs. I went with the D size and glad I did. The C wouldn’t have been near big enough. My hull is 18’+ and at least 94” wide. The Ultrex sits high and this cover just does cover the rub rails with the Ultrex. No seats in place. It’s a medium weight cover. Not super light but not as heavy as the factory covers.
customer_reviews.author: J.W.

customer_reviews.title: We bought the biggest one and it fit nicely over all the surface area
customer_reviews.text: We got the biggest size so it would fit over all the surface areas without stretching it too much. It even allowed room for the upright poles inside that keep the water from pooling in the middle areas. Go for the thickest & heaviest deniers so you don't accidentally punch a hole in the cover. It's an investment you won't regret.
customer_reviews.author: U of M Griz Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this boat cover. For the price I got more then I expected. The material is heavier than I thought it would be and it fits my boat perfectly. The straps are sewn on and sturdy. I don't trailer it but I have had it on and off several times and feel it will last a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: Edna Connors

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: We have a 16ft 2004 Aluminum Smokercraft, and this 14-16ft cover version barely fit length wise. I do recommend getting a support pole or two with this, depending on how your boat is situated. Wide it was perfect, but length was super close, made it work though. Can't beat the price and the material doesn't look too bad. We'll see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great cover
customer_reviews.text: This product was very easy to put on. We purchased the 19-21 foot to cover our 18 foot boat. Had extra to cover up the prop. Material was well made and came with straps to secure it to the trailer. Will update after the winter to add how it faired with the rain, ice and snow. For the price would highly recommend this boat cover.
customer_reviews.author: Karzak

customer_reviews.title: Great boat cover...not so much
customer_reviews.text: Rained heavily and kept boat dry. Great cover fits perfect. Bought 2 of these. Update. Revising my review. The cover pretty much completely disintegrated in 1.5 years in the Arizone sun. Straps and cover. Now completely useless and what a mess.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another boat cover I got on Amazon that lasted about a year and was smaller than advertised. This one fits perfectly and is faster to get on and off than the old one. Very satisfied with it
customer_reviews.author: S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Boat cover fits good. I ordered the next size up because of other reviews I read. I’m glad I did. Not only did it cover our 17ft Gregor it was large enough to cover the motor as well. The carting bag is big enough to easily roll up the cover and put it back in for storage. Feels sturdy so far. We have only had it a week but it’s been on/off 3x and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cover
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be of good quality. Put it on our 12' row boat. The cover does sag so you'll need to place some kind of support under it so rain and snow runs off. I plan on using 1/2" PVC pipe across the width to make the cover bow to the sides. Have to wait till spring to see how well the cover performed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I have paid double for lower Quality
customer_reviews.text: could not believe the quality of the cover. I have spent twice as much in the past and did not get this nice of a cover. I made cheap frame from 2x2 and bought two sheets of insulation board that sits on top of the frame. Make a perfect support for the cover so i dont have to fight water issues all year. I would 100 percent recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Could have came with clear instructions
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our new boat. Did NOT come with any instructions so I was stuck looking at the pictures to see how to hook it all up. Still water collects and pools on the top, in which we need to dump off. It does it's job - just wish there were better installation instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY MATERIAL!
customer_reviews.text: Am very impressed with the material, feels strong, good stitching and a great black color.Fits my 19ft 2020 182sc side console deck/sport Stingray boat. Love how it looks, comes with instructions and a bunch of clip-on tiedowns. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: R.DIAZ USMC VET

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: 18 ft Crownline. Fits well. Think it would fit a 19ft boat very well also due to the elastic perimeter. Feels like good quality. Already rained and cover is doing it’s job. Very happy with this purchase. I don’t plan to trailer the boat with the cover on but plenty of tie down points if you do decide to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Chris donelson

customer_reviews.title: It fits and is waterproof-
customer_reviews.text: Simple to place on my Rinker 210 with the rear swim platform--order the 24 foot for this type of boat--So far it is doing it's job in this brutal Ohio weather--the adjustable straps could be a little longer for the middle as I had to use a bungee cord to attach the center strap-- But-for the price I like it!
customer_reviews.author: nurscop

customer_reviews.title: Fits well and sturdy fabric
customer_reviews.text: Nice blue color too, and the straps may actually hold it on the boat in transit (not possible with any of my prior covers). Pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: thequickbrownfox

customer_reviews.title: Beware.........fabric varies by color
customer_reviews.text: The cover shredded on the first road trip we took. We had it secured and tight as directed. Terrible product. We didn't have it 60 days. Am contacting Amazon about it. This cover was only 150D fabric not 600D as lead to believe by the general description. They are refunding our money without a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 20’ Searay open bow w/ integrated swim step
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect. Looks great. Good quality. I haven’t gone down highway yet, but I would. I thought straps would be sown into canvas across top. They are separate and take time on initial set up, but should function to relieve stress on cover.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Boat Cover
customer_reviews.text: I was very satisfied with this boat cover, it was a heavy strong material, well made and well described. Shipping was fast too. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Claude

customer_reviews.title: Really nice,  durable boat cover
customer_reviews.text: We've bought a cover off Amazon before for our boat and it got ripped and faded and held a lot of water. We replaced it with this one and it's really durable and doesn't hold much water due to the placements of the straps. Easy to put on and thick waterproof material.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna B.

customer_reviews.title: NIce cover - careful of size
customer_reviews.text: I looks like a nice cover - heavy duty and nice looking. Unfortunately I ordered it too small and waited util I finished some engine work to replace the old cover. Since it is past the return time of 30 days, I can't send it back. Trying to sell it on eBay.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to “waterproof”
customer_reviews.text: Cover fit my SeaSwirl Spyder 188 great. However this cover is by no means water proof. I’d say water resistant is pushing it. Light rain today maybe a 1/16th of an inch and the interior of my boat was soaked. I’d say it’s about as waterproof as a pair of jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I just received this boat cover a couple days ago. All I can give you is my first impression at this point, but it is very good. this seems to be made of a really good material and it's heavy duty. It fit very nicely on my boat and I'm very pleased in this product so far. It's more than I thought I was getting.
customer_reviews.author: T. Korabek

customer_reviews.title: not trailerable and straps already breaking
customer_reviews.text: Pro: water proof Cons: elastic band around edge is not strong enough for highway. needs draw rope for tight secure fit. Straps are breaking after 6 months. heavy rain causes pooling even with straps tight and support pole in middle Will not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Proud Mom

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cover... Good quality material and strong... Straps work well and attached easy... Worth spend the extra few bucks for this cover as it is worth the price...
customer_reviews.author: Theodore J. Matela III

customer_reviews.title: Great cover, fits well
customer_reviews.text: Just got this, fits my 18’ Reinell great! Will see how it holds up over time, reviews for so many different covers say none really keep water out or last more than 1-2 seasons. Looks and fits great for now...
customer_reviews.author: Luke Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value! Great cover!
customer_reviews.text: We've been searching for a cover for our Boston whaler, and found this one on Amazon. It is an exceptional cover, sure to give us years of protection from the elements. This cover was an excellent value, and will be buying another one for our other boat!
customer_reviews.author: Kaye's Account

customer_reviews.title: Quality feel but didn’t fit as stated
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit tri-hull as stated. I have a 1971 Chrysler Sport Fury Deluxe and it kept coming up at the nose when I pulled it back towards the windshield. It was deep V shaped more than a relaxed V which may have allowed the better fit. 2 stars equals hassle free return and product quality. Otherwise it’d be 1.
customer_reviews.author: J.Burton

customer_reviews.title: Fits nicely around all the edges.
customer_reviews.text: These boat covers are easy to rig up and protect the interior of our boat during transportation and storage. The fabric is very rugged, but easy to fit over the boat and strap down. It folds up into a compact size when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Water got between the 2 layers of fabric.
customer_reviews.text: First rain, the Water got between the 2 layers of material. Its slowly dripping into the boat as. I have no way of getting the water out without cutting the cover. The cover was a nice, tough material. It fit good with the adjustable straps for our little 12 foot fishing boat. Just wish it didn't get water inside the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, Well designed, strong, quality material boat cover goes long way!
customer_reviews.text: This cover is surly waterproof and secures the boat. Quality of the fabric is strong and well designed boat cover. I actually got it for my father’s boat and he has no complaints so far. I wish they had more color choices. 👍
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: This cover is not trailerable.
customer_reviews.text: This cover is NOT trailerable it completely tore itself apart in the first 50 mikes down the road. It beat up my upholstery and left permanent marks all over my board and upholstery. The cheap nylon straps left thick black scuff marks all over my boat that had to be removed with solvent. This cover would probably be fine to keep dust off your boat while you store it but it is def not a trailerable cover and should not be sold as such as it permanently marred my boat in attempt to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall duran

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as expected
customer_reviews.text: Even when tightened down as much as possible, rain water pools on the cover in both the bow and stern seating areas. So much water that a sump pump is used! This cover should only be used on top of properly supported canvas covers.
customer_reviews.author: BCole

customer_reviews.title: Nice little cover.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice cover, i wouldn't trust it riding down the highway with it on but i don't think anyone would do that. I'd recommend buying one size up, i have a 16 foot bass boat and i bought the 17-19 ft size, fits perfect. I'll update if i have any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Massive Tear By Second Month
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for our 21ft bowrider about 2 months ago. The fit was great and the included straps were easy to use. Unfortunately, the cover’s quality and durability were not what we hoped for. It started with a small rip in the very center about a week ago when tightening the cover. Went out this morning to see a massive tear across the center. Although the price was great and we didn’t expect it to last forever, we are extremely disappointed that it didn’t even make it 60 days.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great cover
customer_reviews.text: This cover fit my 19.5 Aluminum deep V hill boat perfectly. I cannot speak for the durability but the material seems strong and hearty. The only thing I was disappointed with was that the bag would not fit over my kicker motor. I have an 8 horse mercury trolling motor and the cover was just barely too small to fit over the motor.
customer_reviews.author: B VanC

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: At first, this appeared to be a good product. But the fit was never tight and secure, and now, less than 3 months after ordering it, it is showing signs of dry rot, and splitting. It hasn't been abused, other than rain. Definitley would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Lipp

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent cover for the price. Keeps my boat covered and dry. Took a 12 hour drive on fishing trip with the cover on as it is supposed to be trailerable and it tore in half from the wind. I purchased another one but won’t try driving with it on.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Leake

customer_reviews.title: It did not even last four months.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cover on May 31, 2020 and four months later it already has a big rip in it. The cover has not been removed during that time, so it's not due to mishandling.
customer_reviews.author: JJLINK

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: This boat cover worked out awsomely for me. I was a bit frustrated at first because I thought I ordered the wrong size, turned out I didn't lay it out right and was trying to put the stern on the bow. After I figured that out, I was really impressed with the strapping system and ease at which it went on. The fabric seems durable and seams are stitched well.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Crandall

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for from china
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it to cover a Jon boat that I've converted to a bass boat. Good thing I wasn't looking forward to anything of quality. I'll be using it more or less for a dust cover and that's about all it's good for. Fact still remains if it's from china it's junk, because their the ones that invented the word.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Estes  Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This arrived fairly quickly, great fit, sturdy construction, seems like a really good product, price point was good.
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, good quality material
customer_reviews.text: This is only a month old, but so far this cover has held up through some very heavy rainstorms. This cover has integrated straps and is much heavier and higher quality than the ones from bass pro. I spent less money through these guys and received a much higher quality cover. So far, I’m impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Harris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit...
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 18.5 foot Regal boat better than the original custom cover. Reinforcements are in exact right spot for windshield and stress points. Strap positions in good spots and work great. Can strap either to trailer frame, or run long straps under boat belly when not using for trailering. Material is heavy and should hold up well. So far, rain beads up and runs off nicely. A couple early snowfalls didn't affect it at all and there was no sagging. Lastly, this cover does indeed have an air vent (to relieve trailering wind pressure) on each side at the rear. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H.

customer_reviews.title: Won't last.
customer_reviews.text: Straps do not last. Bought this cover and in 10 months ago and every cross strap has disintegrated. Even the mounting points for the tie-downs are falling apart. It does keep the water out, but now may not since you can't tie down.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Silva

customer_reviews.title: A right sized cover
customer_reviews.text: I looked for a while to find a boat cover to fit my 11 foot runabout, plus the engine. This cover fit well. Nicely sewn, nicely packaged. It is under cover, so I was not to worried about the sun destroying it. Great cover for the price. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Dave K.

customer_reviews.title: I love this cover!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this cover for a 16' Back Troller. I love this cover. I really love the tie downs that go across the boat to keep it tight when pulling it. Buy it, you'll love it. When I need another it will be this one for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Ben from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but don't make the same mistake I did
customer_reviews.text: The cover was very good quality, the straps were durable and the seams were well stitched. However while the measurements I took were correct for the size cover I needed I didn't factor in the the railings on the front of the boat which made the cover too tight to fully cover boat (the width ended up being too short). I fully recommend this product based on the quality and feel but just make sure you factor in things like that into your measurements.
customer_reviews.author: guyzieman

customer_reviews.title: Nice Boat Cover but buckled under water pressure
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice boat cover and definitely keeps the boat dry but this boat cover buckled under water pressure. I also purchased this item  The support pole failed multiple times and the boat filled up with so much water that the boat cover ripped all the way across the front end of the boat cover. Luckily I know how to use a sewing machine and was able to repair the huge tear in the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to replace an old torn cover. This one is a much better fit and stronger than the old cover. I especially like the reinforcement areas for the bow, windshield and stern.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Pankow

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The cover fit our boat perfectly. We have had considerable rains and the cover has worked like a charm. My husband is very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed with this boat cover! Way better quality than I was expecting for what I paid for it! Easy on and off. Great Quality! Fits perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof... left my boat full of water.
customer_reviews.text: If you like to wake up and pump water out of your boat, this cover is for you. If you don't mind putting a tarp on before you use this cover - this cover is for you. Safe to say, it's junk. Save yourself and buy a different product.
customer_reviews.author: McKee

product_meta.title: iCOVER Trailerable Boat Cover, 600D Heavy Duty Waterproof UV Resistant Marine Grade Polyester Fits V-Hull,TRI-Hull,Pro-Style,Fishing Boat,Runabout,Bass Boat, Optional Support Pole/Tightening Strap
feature_bullets: 【Universal Boat Cover】TRAILERABLE, Fits V-HULL fishing boat; V-hull Tri-hull runabout, bass boat; Fish&Ski; Pro-style bass boat, Fits boat up to 20ft-23ft long and beam width up to 100in, please refer to iCOVER boat cover size chart to find the right size to fit your boat.

【Waterproof and UV Resistant Design 】Made of Durable Canvas Fabric with water resistant PVC coating and anti-UV finish, this boat cover is easy to withstand tearing, fading, wetting and cold cracking, keeping your boat protected from harsh weather all year-round.
【Full Protection】 Heavy duty elastic cord sewn in around hemline for secure and snug fit. Integrated buckle and adjustable strap tightening system provides easy installation and quick release.

【Versatile Use】The cover is perfect for boat storage, mooring and trailering. To Avoid water to accumulate on the cover, please use support pole beneath the cover. iCOVER sells support pole separately.
【Risk Free Shopping】At iCOVER,we provide 12 MONTHS WARRANTY for any quality-related issue.100% Satisfaction or your money back! No questions asked!
